metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125012 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been classified asproblematic. Affected is an unknown function of the filelibavcodec/dxtroy.c. The manipulation leads to integer coercion error. Itis possible to launch the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply apatch to fix this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.2-2').
